greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of 4th powers of primes dividing n.
comment: Primes taken without multiplicity, e.g., 12 = 2*2*3, and a(12) = 2^4+3^4 = 97. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Jul 16 2014
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} prime(k)^4*x^prime(k)/(1 - x^prime(k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Dec 24 2018
program: def a(n): return sum(p**4 for p in primefactors(n))
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 11 2017
(PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); sum(k=1, #f~, f[k,1]^4); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 11 2017
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
